content.raw:
Nah, I fixed it.

I also bumped the version number of labscript_utils and changed BLACS' check_version line to require the newest version - because it is now relying on a variable in the labconfig module that didn't previously exist.

In future I'll try to remember to point out when version bumps are required, try to take note whenever you are introducing dependencies on newer functionality in other modules so we can remember to bump version numbers and checks. Otherwise if we're in an out of date environment we get "cannot import name hostname" rather than "BLACS requires labscript_utils > 2.3.1".
content.html:
Nah, I fixed it.

I also bumped the version number of labscript_utils and changed BLACS' check_version line to require the newest version - because it is now relying on a variable in the labconfig module that didn't previously exist.

In future I'll try to remember to point out when version bumps are required, try to take note whenever you are introducing dependencies on newer functionality in other modules so we can remember to bump version numbers and checks. Otherwise if we're in an out of date environment we get "cannot import name hostname" rather than "BLACS requires labscript_utils > 2.3.1".
